title: Which region would you love to see more of?
body:
The latest region update has been awesome, but there’s been a few complaints about the amount of attention Bilgewater receives in comparison to other regions. 

Out of interest, what regions would you want Riot to focus on next/to receive the same amount of love?

replies.body: More of? Assuming that we have seen anything at all about Bandle City

They haven't finished the Noxus lore update yet. Several Noxian champions are currently trapped in limbo. So, Noxus gets my vote.

Otherwise, Shadow Isles/Void.

Never enough from Piltover and Zaun.
Hope we can get some insight about Chemtech, Twitch and Singed are related to that topic and they are missing their lore update.

And I **need** some stuff about the cultivairs, they fascinate me.

I don't get to decide so I felt safe voting like a player here.

It was diffictult for me to decide between Shurima, or Zaun.  If I'd read this far down to be reminded of how flippin' awesome the cultivairs are, I might have decided to go with Zaun instead of the Shurima I chose.  (Remembering that what I chose has nothing to do with what's coming.)

I love the images of the cultivairs so much, that I've been hand painting a set of Moroccan style tea glasses with Zaun wrought iron styled patterns in tribute.  It's taking ages, but they look so pretty (even if they are a bit handmade looking!)

A cultivair is a large glass, curved/spherical building specifically designed to grow plants and generate pure air for the wealthiest in Zaun.  

If you look at the scrolling Piltover-Zaun page, you can see a picture and description in the space between the bottom of Piltover and the top of Zaun: https://eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/piltover#industrial-splendor

Imagine living in such an incredibly polluted city, and these green glowing jewels of the promise of fresh air and clean lungs, hanging like emeralds from a fancy person's necklace out over the chasms of Zaun.  They remind me of wardian cases, Victorian greenhouses, the 'Sailor's Eyeball' algae, and a tiny bit of Bioshock for luck :)  I imagine they've got the highest security, lest those scummy Sumprat kids dare think they can steal a clean breath from the rich and powerful - and I imagine they get in to these verdant paradises anyway.

And Baccai are neat, sure - but I'm interested in the geological, ecological, cultural, and political upheaval from the return of Azir, the capital, and most especially, the river.

Thanks both to you, SatomiKun and Bioluminescence (Wish that wonder of nature was more common in our world, like how it is in Pandora of Avatar movie. I don't wanna die before seeing it.)

Have you ever seen a Baccai though? I remember Sharjo seeing them. By your personal opinion, do you think we will have more information about them in the future?

Does the Kumungu Jungle count as a region? Like is it still a thing?

In case you are serious about the first question:
Cultivairs are the gardens in Zaun, inhabited by chembarons and rich Zaunites. People who are able to afford holding a whole building to keep plants alive in the polluted city.

https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-FF0PtQTywQ0/WHfa--MqyJI/AAAAAAAAb5Y/wqYLIhKjqrQa2e4TG_5gdHr3WXXaIKDFgCLcB/s1600/zaun4.jpg
Just imagine this small wonder. Zaun is a city filled with toxic waste, the Zaun Grey and cruel experiments. And in that hell of a place, a small green island of life and beauty.

I want a new Chembaron champion from Zaun next and the story should finally describe such a cultivair from the inside. People going there to escape the madness for some peaceful minutes surrounded by nature.
These are the 2 I love most, though I'd include piltover. I think the combined piltover/zaun is just so cool

While {{champion:76}} and {{champion:143}} are the only confirmed ones,I'd say that {{champion:107}} is most likely from there as well,given that Nidalee is implied is likely a vastayan shapeshifter and the fact that her animal form is a cougar would suggest a connection to the kiilash,rengars tribe.
Rengar is from Shurima
This is heartbreaking.
"Void" is not a region of the world of Runeterra. Maybe you meant "Icathia".

I think the opener just meant the different factions that are listed on the universe page.

Sure technically the void is more of a place of origin,but its treated as a faction for the voidborns/void-related champs for the sake of simplicity.

Then I wouldn't have paired it up with Shurima. The Void is its own thing and what interests me the most right now is an explanation of its origins (aka where it is exactly, how and why the Watchers created it, why voidborn champions look so different from the depiction of voidborns in the Icathian story).

I agree that pairing the void and Shurima was kinda odd.

Sure the 2 groups are closely related(all the voidchamps in the game are from shurima),but there are other factions that deal with the void as well(Targon and the marai),so they are not exclusive to Shurima.

Also the voidborn in the icathian story were essentially newborn creatures,which is why they looked so different.
They mention on the universe page,that the voidborn don't have a solid form when they first enter runeterra,but that they create one eventually once they remain in runeterra for enough time.

However this was likely done,because we have only a limited number of options when making a poll,so grouping some factions together was likely preferable than leaving some out altogether.

So the voidborn in the icathian story were essentially babies,while the ones we have ingame are adults(or at least a kid in Kog'maws case)
Ok, but they still look extremely different from {{champion:121}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:96}} {{champion:421}}, who are also wildly different from each other.

Because they haven't taken form yet.
They enter the world of runeterra as this shapeless thing,which will then adapt to a new form.Its like they are born as clay and eventually evolve into a vase.

Because of this each voidborn is unique in their appearance(though this does not necessarily go for voidcreatures that are spawned by others)

I already know that. My question is: why is that?
Why do those empty geometrical forms turn into fully functioning pluricellular organisms with a highly variable level of intelligence? Why do some of them take similar forms while others look like they're part of an entire different species? Why is Vel'Koz so extraordinarily different from his brethren in almost every aspect?

Also, was the Void created by the Watchers or did it always exist and the Watchers created only its inhabitants?
There are so many questions left unanswered.
Bandle City is basically a myth, I'm not even sure the Riot Lore team knows if it exists. :P

Shadow Isles for sure. But more specifically, I want the story of {{champion:82}}  reascending to the throne. They've been dropping hints everywhere that it's coming, and he's damned overdue for a VGU to go with it.  Actually that could be a combined Shadow Isles and Noxus update, since any return of Mordekaiser would probably have him eyeing his former domain and seat of power.

I voted for Piltover because I want more content on Vi. I'm meh at playing her, but I like her as a character. (I also voted that because I don't expect much new content for Ionia for a while, though I'd love to see something involving Irelia and Riven.)
I still want a Noxian support, not having one seems soo odd.

Actually, Morgana is considered Noxian. So we actually do have one! I think every region has a support, but on the other hand, not every region has an adc. I think Mount Targon is the only Region with out an ADC (No. I do not count Panth as an adc. Much as I love me a Leona/Pantheon lane), though I could be wrong!

The hundreds of other city-states, nations, and locations we have not yet seen fleshed out but exist. The Medarda map basically give us a ton of them.

Piltover. We know a lot of things ABOUT piltover, but we dont really know piltover itself. how did it start? when did hextech start? Why be located where it is? why has no one tried to claim it for themselves? etc

how about the crystal scar?
where'd that vanish to?

I feel like I'm a minority in that I care more about specific characters than I do regional storylines.  Although probably Demacia/Shurima ({{champion:99}} {{champion:163}} are pretty close to their respective regions' stories).  But then {{champion:61}} seems largely to be uninvolved with the main Zaun/Piltover story, especially with her dream to go see the world I find it hard to see her become a part of it; I'd rather see her travelling.
